content.prompt: Ethylene gas is an organic molecule that serves many cell signaling roles in flowering plants. Which of the following best explains how a positive feedback mechanism involving ethylene works?

choices.label: Cells of ripening fruit produce ethylene, which activates the ripening response in other fruit cells.
Low water stress causes cells to produce ethylene, which binds to root cells and initiates cell division.
Cells damaged by leaf-eating insects produce ethylene, which is released into the air, and repels insects.
Fertilized ovules produce ethylene, which initiates apoptosis in flower petal cells.

skill.text: 1.C: Explain biological concepts and processes in applied contexts.
